note.p: Workhouse and school inspector, and philanthropist. Sister of Thomas Hughes, author of Tom Brown’s schooldays. Married Nassau John Senior in 1848. Lived in Clapham from 1860; helped support her family by giving singing lessons. Directed the ladies’ committee of the London office of the Red Cross during the Franco-Prussian war and was awarded the Red Cross medal. Appointed inspector of workhouses and workhouse pauper schools, 1873; resigned through ill health, 1874.
